00016 /*
00017   =============================================================================
00018   APOXI Library for UNICODE to/from UTF8 conversion.
00019   =============================================================================
00020   UnicodeNextUtf8      Searches the beginning of the next UTF-8 character
00021                        in the UTF-8 string.
00022 
00023   UnicodePreviousUtf8  Searches the beginning of the previous UTF-8 character
00024                        in the UTF-8 string
00025 
00026   UnicodeUtf8Strlen    Calculates the length of the UTF-8 string with limited
00027                        length.
00028 
00029   UnicodeLastUtf8      Searches for the last UTF-8 character in UTF-8 string.
00030   UnicodeGetUtf8       Fetch the next UTF-8 character from P into result and
00031                        convert it into the UNICODE value.
00032   UnicodePutUtf8       Convert a single UNICODE character to UTF-8 character
00033                        and send it to UTF-8 output buffer.
00034   UnicodeUtf8Strchr    Finds the first occurrence of the UNICODE character in
00035                        the UTF-8 string.
00036   UnicodeOffsetToIndex Searches for beginning of offset of UTF-8 character in
00037                        UTF-8 string and returns its offset in bytes.
00038   UnicodeIndexToOffset Searches for number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8
00039                        string in first offset bytes.
00040 
00041   UnicodeToUtf8        Convert UNICODE string to UTF-8 string and return length
00042                        counted including terminating null-character.
00043   Utf8ToUnicode        Convert UTF-8 string to UNICODE string and return length
00044                        counted including terminating null-character.
00045   
00046   UnicodeFromUtf8      Convert UTF-8 string to UNICODE string and return length
00047                        counted excluding terminating null-character.
00048   Utf8FromUnicode      Convert UNICODE string to UTF-8 string and return length
00049                        counted excluding terminating null-character.
00050 
00051   UnicodeUtf8Validate  Validates UTF-8 encoded text.
00052 
00053   UnicodeStrlen        Find length of UNICODE string.
00054   UnicodeStringWidth   Same as UnicodeStrlen.
00055   UnicodeStrncpy       Copies a given number of bytes from one string into
00056                        another.
00057   UnicodeStrcmp        Compares a portion of one UNICODE string to a portion
00058                        of another with case sensitivity.
00059   UnicodeStrncmp       Compares a portion of one UNICODE string to a portion
00060                        of another with case sensitivity.
00061   UnicodeStrstr        Scans UNICODE string for the occurrence of a given
00062 
00063   
00064   Common warning:
00065 
00066   The caller and his/her C/C++ compiler are responsible for proper arguments
00067   boundary on the stack by calling some function; on some systems (depending on
00068   target processor), access to an element bigger than a byte (short, integer, long,
00069   etc.) and located on an odd address, can cause address error exception (or even
00070   something worse).
00071 
00072   =============================================================================
00073 */
00074 
00075 #include  <Kernel/Types.hpp>
00076 #include  <Auxiliary/StrUtil.hpp>

00078 #define APOXI_UNICODE_EOF (WCHAR)0xffff
00079 
00080 /*
00081       UnicodeToUtf8
00082 Description:
00083         Scans UNICODE string buffer and converts UNICODE characters into UTF-8
00084         characters and copies UTF-8 characters to destination buffer.
00085         Destination buffer must have enough space available.
00086 Arguments:
00087           utf8      Pointer to destination memory buffer receiving converted UNICODE.
00088                     If this pointer is 0 (NULL), no conversion will be done but the
00089                     number of UTF-8 characters needed for conversion is returned
00090                     (including null-terminator).
00091           unicode   Pointer to a memory buffer holding text in UNICODE data format,
00092                     must be null-terminated.
00093 Returns:
00094         The number of UTF-8 characters generated (including null-terminator).
00095 Notes:
00096         Be aware that the generated UNICODE string will be null-terminated. The 
00097         difference to the function "Utf8FromUnicode" is therefore just the counting
00098         of the length, the string conversion and generation is the same.
00099 */
00100 INT UnicodeToUtf8(CHAR *utf8, const WCHAR *unicode);
00101 
00102 
00103 /*
00104       Utf8ToUnicode
00105 Description:
00106         Scans UTF-8 string buffer and converts UTF-8 characters into UNICODE
00107         characters and copies UNICODE characters to destination buffer.
00108         Destination buffer must have enough space available.
00109 Arguments:
00110           unicode   Pointer to destination memory buffer receiving converted UTF-8.
00111                     If this pointer is 0 (NULL), no conversion will be done but the
00112                     number of UNICODE characters needed for conversion is returned
00113                     (including null-terminator).
00114           utf8      Pointer to a memory buffer holding text in UTF-8 data format,
00115                     must be null-terminated.
00116 Returns:
00117         The number of UNICODE characters generated (including null-terminator).
00118 Notes:
00119         Be aware that the generated UTF-8 string will be null-terminated. The 
00120         difference to the function "UnicodeFromUtf8" is therefore just the counting
00121         of the length, the string conversion and generation is the same.
00122 */
00123 INT Utf8ToUnicode(WCHAR *unicode, const CHAR *utf8);

00126 /*
00127       UnicodeFromUtf8
00128 Description:
00129         Scans UTF-8 string buffer and converts UTF-8 characters into UNICODE
00130         characters and copies UNICODE characters to destination buffer.
00131         Destination buffer must have enough space available.
00132 Arguments:
00133           unicode   Pointer to destination memory buffer receiving converted UTF-8.
00134                     If this pointer is 0 (NULL), no conversion will be done but the
00135                     number of UNICODE characters needed for conversion is returned
00136                     (excluding null-terminator).
00137           utf8      Pointer to a memory buffer holding text in UTF-8 data format,
00138                     must be null-terminated.
00139 Returns:
00140         The number of UNICODE characters generated (excluding null-terminator).
00141 Notes:
00142         Be aware that the generated UNICODE string will be null-terminated. The 
00143         difference to the function "Utf8ToUnicode" is therefore just the counting
00144         of the length, the string conversion and generation is the same.
00145 */
00146 INT UnicodeFromUtf8(WCHAR *unicode, const CHAR *utf8);

00149 /*
00150       Utf8FromUnicode
00151 Description:
00152         Scans UNICODE string buffer and converts UNICODE characters into UTF-8
00153         characters and copies UTF-8 characters to destination buffer.
00154         Destination buffer must have enough space available.
00155 Arguments:
00156           utf8      Pointer to destination memory buffer receiving converted UNICODE.
00157                     If this pointer is 0 (NULL), no conversion will be done but the
00158                     number of UTF-8 characters needed for conversion is returned
00159                     (excluding null-terminator).
00160           unicode   Pointer to a memory buffer holding text in UNICODE data format,
00161                     must be null-terminated.
00162 Returns:
00163         The number of UTF-8 characters generated (excluding null-terminator).
00164 Notes:
00165         Be aware that the generated UTF-8 string will be null-terminated. The 
00166         difference to the function "UnicodeToUtf8" is therefore just the counting
00167         of the length, the string conversion and generation is the same.
00168 */
00169 INT Utf8FromUnicode(CHAR *utf8, const WCHAR *unicode);

00172 /*
00173       UnicodeUtf8Validate
00174 Description:
00175         Validates UTF-8 encoded text. str is the text to validate. If str is
00176         null-terminated, then max_len can be -1, otherwise max_len should be
00177         the number of bytes to validate. If end is non-NULL, then the end of
00178         the valid range will be stored there (i.e. the address of the first
00179         invalid byte if some bytes were invalid, or the end of the text being
00180         validated otherwise).
00181         Many routines valid UTF8 as input. So data read from a file or the
00182         network should be checked with this function before doing
00183         anything else with it.
00184 Arguments:
00185           str     a pointer to character data
00186         max_len max bytes to validate, or -1 to go until null
00187         end     return location for end of valid data
00188 Returns:
00189         TRUE if the text was valid UTF-8, otherwise FALSE.
00190 */
00191 INT UnicodeUtf8Validate(const CHAR *str, INT max_len, const CHAR **end);
00192 
00193 
00194 /*
00195       UnicodePreviousUtf8
00196 Description:
00197         Searches the beginning of the previous UTF-8 character in the UTF-8
00198         string.
00199 Arguments:
00200           start     pointer to the beginning of the UTF-8 string.
00201           p         pointer insidee the UTF-8 string.
00202 Returns:
00203         Pointer to the beginning of the UTF-8 character
00204         If P points to the middle of an UTF-8 character, this function
00205         returns a pointer to the first byte of the character.
00206         If P points to the start of an UTF-8 character, this function returns a
00207         pointer to the first byte of the previous character.
00208         If P does not point to an UTF-8 character, NULL is returned.
00209         START bounds the search, in no case will a value before START be
00210         returned.
00211         If p does not point inside UTF-8 string the result is false
00212 */
00213 CHAR *UnicodePreviousUtf8 (const CHAR *start, const CHAR *p);
00214 
00215 
00216 /*
00217     UnicodeNextUtf8
00218 Description:
00219         Searches the beginning of the next UTF-8 character in the UTF-8 string.
00220 Arguments:
00221           p         pointer inside the UTF-8 string.
00222 Returns:
00223         Returns pointer to the next UTF-8 character in the string of the UTF-8
00224         characters
00225         Return pointer to the first byte of the next UTF-8 character after P.
00226         This works whether P points to the start or to the middle of an UTF-8
00227         character.
00228         P is assumed to be null-terminated.
00229         If p does not point inside the UTF-8 string, the result is false
00230 */
00231 CHAR *UnicodeNextUtf8 (const CHAR *p);
00232 
00233 
00234 /*
00235     UnicodeUtf8Strlen
00236 Description:
00237         Calculates the length of the UTF-8 string with limited length
00238 Arguments:
00239           p         pointer to a valid UTF-8 character.
00240           max       limited number of characters for the search function.
00241 Returns:
00242         Return the length, in characters, of p, an UTF-8 string.  Max is the
00243         maximum number of bytes to examine.  If max is less than 0, then P is
00244         assumed to be null-terminated.
00245 */
00246 UINT  UnicodeUtf8Strlen (const CHAR *p, INT max);
00247 
00248 
00249 /*
00250       UnicodeStrlen
00251 Description:
00252         Find length of UNICODE string.
00253 Arguments:
00254         unicode pointer to the start of an UTF-8 string.
00255         max     the maximum number of WCHAR objects to examine.
00256 Returns:
00257         Function returns length of an UNICODE string in  WCHAR characters
00258 */
00259 UINT  UnicodeStrlen(const WCHAR *unicode, INT max);
00260 
00261 
00262 /*
00263     UnicodeStringWidth
00264 Description:
00265         Calculates the length of the UTF-8 string with no length limitation
00266 Arguments:
00267           p         pointer to a valid UTF-8 character.
00268 Returns:
00269         Return the length, in characters, of p, an UTF-8 string.  Max is the
00270         maximum number of bytes to examine.  If max is less than 0, then P is
00271         assumed to be null-terminated.
00272         Returns the visual width, in character-size units, of P, a string. This
00273         value may be used for tabulation.
00274 */
00275 UINT  UnicodeStringWidth(const CHAR *p);

00278 /*
00279     UnicodeGetUtf8
00280 Description:
00281         Fetch the next UTF-8 character from P into result and convert it into
00282         the UNICODE value.
00283 Arguments:
00284           p         pointer to the valid UTF-8 character.
00285           result    pointer to the location into which the UNICODE value of the
00286                   UTF-8 character returns.
00287 Returns:
00288         If the next character is a valid UTF-8 character, rasult holds UNICODE
00289         value of UTF-8 character. If the character is not valid, result holds -1.
00290         The function returns a pointer to the start of the next UTF-8 character.
00291         If p is not well formed, it will return NULL.
00292 */
00293 CHAR *UnicodeGetUtf8(const CHAR *p, WCHAR *result);

00296 /*
00297     UnicodePutUtf8
00298 Description:
00299         Convert a single UNICODE CHAR to UTF-8 CHAR and send it to UTF-8 output
00300         buffer.
00301 Arguments:
00302           c         ISO10646 character code.
00303           outbuf    output buffer must have at least 6 bytes of space. If %NULL,
00304                   the length will be computed and returned and nothing will be
00305                   written to @out.
00306 Returns:
00307         number of bytes written
00308 */
00309 INT UnicodePutUtf8(WCHAR c, CHAR *outbuf);

00312 /*
00313     UnicodeOffsetToIndex
00314 Description:
00315         Function searches for begining of offset of UTF-8 character in UTF-8
00316         string and returns its offset in bytes
00317 Arguments:
00318           p         pointer to a valid UTF-8 string.
00319           offset    offset of UTF-8 character in UTF-8 string.
00320 Returns:
00321         offset of UTF-8 character in UTF-8 string in bytes, if offset is within
00322         the range of UTF-8 string.
00323         If offset is biger then size of UTF-8 string in UTF-8 characters,
00324         function returns size of UTF-8 string in bytes
00325 */
00326 INT UnicodeOffsetToIndex(const CHAR *src, INT offset);
00327 
00328 
00329 /*
00330     UnicodeIndexToOffset
00331 Description:
00332         Function searches for number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string in
00333         first offset bytes.
00334 Arguments:
00335           p         pointer to a valid UTF-8 character.
00336           offset    offset in UTF-8 string in bytes.
00337 Returns:
00338         number of UTF-8 characters in first offset bytes.
00339               if offset is longer than UTF-8 string in bytes, function returns
00340               number of UTF-8 characters
00341 */
00342 INT UnicodeIndexToOffset(const CHAR *src, INT  index);

00345 /*
00346     UnicodeLastUtf8
00347 Description:
00348         Searches for the last UTF-8 character in UTF-8 string
00349 Arguments:
00350           p         pointer to a valid UTF-8 string
00351 Returns
00352         Pointer to the last UTF-8 sequence in a string
00353         If the string is empty, it returns pointer to empty string
00354 */
00355 CHAR *UnicodeLastUtf8(const CHAR *p);

00358 /*
00359       UnicodeStrcmp
00360 Description:
00361         Compares a portion of one string to a portion of another, with case
00362         sensitivity. Function performs a signed comparison of s1 to s2,
00363         starting with the first character in each string and continuing with
00364         subsequent characters until the corresponding characters differ .
00365         The comparison is case sensitive. It returns a value (< 0, 0, or > 0)
00366         based on the result of comparing s1 (or part of it) to s2 (or part of it).
00367 Arguments:
00368           str1   pointer to first Unicode string.
00369           str2   pointer to second Unicode string.
00370 Returns:
00371         If s1 is... returns a value that is...
00372         less than s2    < 0
00373         the same as s2  == 0
00374         greater than s2 > 0
00375 */
00376 INT UnicodeStrcmp( const WCHAR *str1, const WCHAR *str2 );
00377 
00378 
00379 /*
00380       UnicodeStrncmp
00381 Description:
00382         Compares a portion of one string to a portion of another, with case
00383         sensitivity. Function performs a signed comparison of s1 to s2,
00384         for a maximum length of n bytes, starting with the first character in
00385         each string and continuing with subsequent characters until the
00386         corresponding characters differ or until n characters have been examined.
00387         The comparison is not case sensitive. It returns a value (< 0, 0, or > 0)
00388         based on the result of comparing s1 (or part of it) to s2 (or part of it).
00389 Arguments:
00390           str1    pointer to first Unicode string.
00391           str2    pointer to second Unicode string.
00392 Returns:
00393         If s1 is... returns a value that is...
00394         less than s2    < 0
00395         the same as s2  == 0
00396         greater than s2 > 0
00397 */
00398 INT UnicodeStrncmp( const WCHAR *str1, const WCHAR *str2, INT n );
00399

00401 /*
00402       UnicodeStrstr
00403 Description:
00404         Scans a string for the occurrence of a given substring. Function
00405         scans s1 for the first occurrence of the substring s2.
00406 Arguments:
00407           str     pointer to first Unicode string.
00408           sub     pointer to Unicode substring.
00409 Returns:
00410         return a pointer to the element in s1, where s2 begins
00411         (points to s2 in s1). If s2 does not occur in s1, strstr returns null.
00412 */
00413 WCHAR *UnicodeStrstr( const WCHAR *str, const WCHAR *sub );
00414 
00415 
00416 /*
00417       UnicodeStrncpy
00418 Description:
00419         Copies a given number of bytes from one string into another, truncating
00420         or padding as necessary. Strncpy copies up to maxlen characters from src
00421         into dest, truncating or null-padding dest. The target string, dest,
00422         might not be null-terminated if the length of src is maxlen or more.
00423 Arguments:
00424           dest      pointer to destination UTF-8 string
00425           src       pointer to source UTF-8 string
00426           n         maximum number of UTF-8 characters to copy
00427 Returns:
00428         Value strncpy returns dest.
00429 */
00430 CHAR  *UnicodeStrncpy(CHAR *dest, const CHAR *src, UINT n);
00431 
00432 
00433 /*
00434       UnicodeUtf8Strchr
00435 Description:
00436         Scans UNICODE character corresponding to ch, in string p.
00437         Function scans a string in forward direction, looking for a
00438         specific character. It finds the first occurrence of the
00439         unicode WCHAR c in the UTF-8 string s. The null-terminator is considered
00440         to be part of the string.
00441 Arguments:
00442           p         pointer to destination UNICODE string
00443           ch        value of UNICODE character
00444 Returns:
00445         pointer to the first occurrence of the character c in s. If c does not
00446         occur in s, function returns null.
00447 */
00448 CHAR *UnicodeUtf8Strchr(const CHAR *p, WCHAR c);

00450 
00451 #define UTF8_COMPUTE(Char, Mask, Len)                                         \
00452   if (Char < 128)       { Len = 1;  Mask = 0x7f; }                            \
00453   else if ((Char & 0xe0) == 0xc0)                                             \
00454     { Len = 2; Mask = 0x1f; }                                                 \
00455   else if ((Char & 0xf0) == 0xe0)                                             \
00456     { Len = 3; Mask = 0x0f; }                                                 \
00457   else if ((Char & 0xf8) == 0xf0)                                             \
00458     { Len = 4; Mask = 0x07; }                                                 \
00459   else if ((Char & 0xfc) == 0xf8)                                             \
00460     { Len = 5; Mask = 0x03; }                                                 \
00461   else if ((Char & 0xfe) == 0xfc)                                             \
00462     { Len = 6; Mask = 0x01; }                                                 \
00463   else                                                                        \
00464     Len = -1;
00465 
00466 #define UTF8_GET(Result, Chars, Count, Mask, Len)                             \
00467   (Result) = (Chars)[0] & (Mask);                                             \
00468   for ((Count) = 1; (Count) < (Len); ++(Count))                               \
00469     {                                                                         \
00470       if (((Chars)[(Count)] & 0xc0) != 0x80)                                  \
00471         {                                                                     \
00472           (Result) = -1;                                                      \
00473           break;                                                              \
00474     }                                                                     \
00475       (Result) <<= 6;                                                         \
00476       (Result) |= ((Chars)[(Count)] & 0x3f);                                  \
00477 }
